message: Hi Bob, I'm offering you my product for $12,000. I think this is a fair price considering the value it offers. Let me know your thoughts.
I appreciate your offer, but I was thinking more along the lines of $9,500. I'm really interested in the product, but I need to make sure it fits within my budget.

Bob, I understand you're working with a budget, but $9,500 is simply too low for me.  I'm willing to come down to $11,000 to show you I'm serious about making this deal work.  Let's find a middle ground.
I appreciate your willingness to come down to $11,000, but I'm still a bit above my budget. I'd be willing to meet you halfway at $10,500. Can you consider that?
Bob, I'm happy to keep negotiating, but $10,500 is still a bit too low for me.  I'm willing to come down to $11,500. This is a fair price considering the value of the product.  What do you say?
I appreciate your persistence, but $11,500 is still out of my budget. I'm willing to go up to $10,200, but that's as high as I can go. Can you meet me there?
Bob, I'm running out of time here, and I really want to make this deal work. Let's split the difference.  I'll accept $10,800 for the product. This is my final offer.  What do you say?

I appreciate your willingness to split the difference, but $10,800 is still a bit too high for me. I'm willing to meet you halfway from my previous offer of $10,200, so I'll offer $10,400. This is my final offer, I'm not willing to go any lower.
